intro: Henckelia moonii, commonly known as the moonflower, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and has a climbing habit, often growing along tree trunks or shrubs. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while the flowers are composed of five petals that resemble a star. Henckelia moonii thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
